questions.question: A Saxophone is a brass instrument.
The country song  'A Boy Named Sue' was written by Shel Silverstein.
Pete Townshend's solo album, 'White City: A Novel', is set in the metropolitan area of Chicago.
Stephen Chbosky wrote the book 'The Perks of Being A Wallflower'.
Originally, the character Charlie from Charlie and the Chocolate Factory was going to be black.
Harry Potter was born on July 31st, 1980.
The Xenomorph from the science fiction film 'Alien' has acidic blood.
The movie 'The Nightmare before Christmas' was all done with physical objects.
The weapon Clint Eastwood uses in 'Dirty Harry' was a .44 Automag.
